column4: I'm using Edgy but I have not automagic "upgrade" button in upgrade-manager, anyone might know why?
you need to pass -d to it
I tried -d, no success
update-manager -c
Flannel I remember there is a command that tell you the active version of ubuntu can't recall it's name
I think cat /etc/issue will tell you what you're running, but that's not what I meant
Flannel no there is a direct one Flannel may remember that way you will know if it already upgraded or not
python -v if it's 2.5 then you are already at 7.04
nope... lots of libs then 2.4.4c1
umm then your probably half way thru
could you check /etc/apt/source.lst does it shows 7.04 repos?
no edgy repositories
err... no 7.04, but edgy respositories
ahh so something is wrong there. update-manager -c did anything?
but the edgy ones are commented?
update-manager -c checked everything but gave no button
no... the edgy ones are present, it doesn't say in the directions to comment the edgy ones and add feisty ones...
no update-manager should take care of that for you, I'll suggest you comment out the edgy ones and try again.
no
eh?
that file has the places to get packages from if you use a very old one you will be telling your system to go back to that state.
I just meant that I renamed it to some backup to see if it helped, but it actually didn't
Flannel is right it seems to be a more general thing

Flannel, I changed my apt server to the general US one from the official ubuntu one and 13 assorted updates came up in update-amanger, they're installing now and I'll try again after this for a dist upgrade button
